review_title: Okay... but not good or great.
years_at_company: Okay... but not good or great.
pros:
Paycheck every week.
Decent 401k match (5%).
Nice vacation package (for now).
When you get NICET certification you get a raise.
cons:
Poor health insurance plans for a company this size.
Only deposits their matching 401k contribution once a year.
Out of touch upper management.
Low company moral.
Middle management seems to focus on annual bonuses/metrics so the local branch and hourly employees suffer.
Feels like the "voice" of the employee falls on deaf ears.
Seems like ever since the (TYCO/SimplexGrinnell) merger things continue to go downhill.
advice_to_mgmt:
You seem to stress that you are interested in the opinions (annual OHI Survey) of lower level employees, yet nothing has been done or planned to ensure you take care of them. Put your actions where your mouth is.

I understand progress always means change. However, change doesn't always mean progress. Seems like the changes that have happened recently have been a setback.

pros: As a global company, there are many opportunities in many different offices around the world. if you are a successful executive coming from a big corporation, you will have great opportunities here.
cons: They say they have a great employee culture, but the only priority they actually have is making their stakeholders happy while dismissing employee benefits. They also rather hire from outside instead of promoting from within.
advice_to_mgmt: Pay more attention to the needs of your most valuable employees. If not, your experienced and highly talented ones will leave and you will struggle to stay a contender in your industry.

pros: Products reliability, job security, realistic product life cycles. Standard field service benefits, tools, etc.
cons: Industry is shrinking and the focus must remain forward looking. Brick and mortar security needs are able to be handled by cheaper equipment. Competition in retail industry is fierce. New positions come available due to attrition rather than need. No career paths available. Workload is sporadic.
advice_to_mgmt: Diversify industries. Consider focusing more on security needs of industrial and commercial. Focus on new technology. Dump analog cameras, unintelligent EAS systems and focus on the future.

review_title: Port Arthur Facility is a Joke
years_at_company: Port Arthur Facility is a Joke
pros: If you need a place to work and live in the middle of no-where have a big ego and do not like to work this is the place for you.
cons: Management is spotty. Corporate Management will not clean house and remove the old guard . BIG egos with Good Ole Boy politics. This attitude contributes NOTHING to improving the plant or its processes. Lacks business systems.
advice_to_mgmt: Decide if you want a profitable business or a place for big egos to share stories and coffee.

review_title: NOTE THE 30 PLUS PAGES OF 1 STAR REVIEWS BEFORE SIGNING ON W/JCI
years_at_company: NOTE THE 30 PLUS PAGES OF 1 STAR REVIEWS BEFORE SIGNING ON W/JCI
pros: May be a thing of the past as there are currently none.
cons:
- toxic environment
- management is either ghost or micro
- don’t get too comfortable in your job — many have been phased out, moved or are being moved overseas
- horrible transition merger w/Tyco (WEEKS without everyday IT systems to do your job)
- when employees leave on their own or departments are downsized, no replacements
- HR?? Who are they and where are they located?
- if there are decent raises, they must be going to a favored few
- joke: 6 months into the fiscal year and there is still no sales budget
- health plans are awful and very expensive
- 401k match is now a punishment as you need to stay employed the entire calendar year to receive any of it
advice_to_mgmt: I was lucky enough to leave on my own terms. There is no joy in going to work every day where you are met by hurdle after hurdle to get your job done (and what you used to be able to do without thinking). Making excuses all day long for product unavailability and compromised quality takes a toll. Stop thinking about lining your pockets with bonuses and start listening to people who interact with customers—both of whom give the company any positivity it may still deserve.

cons: Some times can be boring

review_title: Company cares more about their customers than their employees
years_at_company: Company cares more about their customers than their employees
pros:
-some ability to telecommute
-fast paced environment, no two days are the same
-decent 401k plan 100% up to 3% and then 50% up to 6%
-3 weeks of vacation starting and 3 elective holidays
cons:
-very little employee training, I had to figure out a lot of things on my own
-management is terrible, they can talk things through to make work more efficient
-very unprofessional atmosphere: sales people walk in or work from home whenever and cuss whenever
-operations team always gets the short end of the stick with little spending: we even had to carpool to a training in another state because management wouldn't reimburse mileage!
-long hours and little reward
-only 1 week of sick leave
-not a diverse workforce
advice_to_mgmt: -care more about your employees than just sales numbers

pros: 401k ,holiday,and vacation time,personal hours rarely weekends but occasionally weekends in lw2
cons: Favortism, upper management is getting strict with any petty thing , were according to there hand book which was created last year. And accordingly to cooperate each plant and location has different handbooks based on what that create.
advice_to_mgmt: Be more forgiving for petty write ups. And listen to your operators POV. About work situations. Where most line supports or even other operators cant fill a spot because only select people are crossed trained.

pros: I get to deal with numbers and some degree of data entry and, get physical exercise.
cons: Some long exhaustive hours, not enough coffee.
advice_to_mgmt: Always strive for continuous excellence.

pros: Ability to sell or 'cross-sell' numerous solutions under one company.
cons: The inability to hire qualified leaders to support new staff. Terrible internal customer service support. There is very little follow through on problem solving and where to find answers.
advice_to_mgmt: Management must know the product and be able to train and support new hires in every aspect of their job. AND must have a billing specialist/admin in each office.

pros: All around great company as big as the are its like a well oiled machinery are not just a employee number, you once accepted after 90 day probation . Everyone is like family, if you need something , anything ask for it and it's yours if it's pertaining to your work.if you have issues in your personal life talk to your coordinator and they will be attentive to your concerns. ,thanks Bill Belamy. Your number 1
cons: My truck was brand new, they purchased all the tools that I needed everything that the union handbook said I needed and more, provided all equipment for a home office for my convience, you need to be a team player...
advice_to_mgmt: Keep doing what you do. Bravo management from every state is great.

pros: Looks good on a resume if you're in Milwaukee
cons: Health benefits are horrid, delay of raises, reduction in 401k base contribution - a benefit they don't even tell employees about, RIF after RIF.
advice_to_mgmt: Quit cutting to make the numbers and actually grow sales instead of talking about it. You say you want to be the premier employer of choice in the area but then do everything you can to make employees leave on their own accord. If they don't you just fire them and move their jobs to a shared service center. By the way, cutting the benefits and telling employees it's to be market competitive is a lie. Just like when you say organizational health isn't about how engaged people are or how much they like their jobs. When all else fails chalk it up to integration!

pros: There are a lot of great people to work with
cons: Johnson Controls took over and ruined everything

pros: Last time I worked was in 05 , it had Great pay and benefits . I’m sure it has changed but I worked there for 20 yrs and I hated to go .
cons: Very stressful at times , I worked in alot of lead and in the formation area which had Acid fumes and burns .
advice_to_mgmt: I’d like to have a better understanding between management and employees. It seemed as far as they wanted to mingle was to the levels of supervisors. Come on down more to us little pple .

pros: Great pay, lots of time off both as vacation and holidays, friendly coworkers
cons: Communication between departments is not great. It's hard to tell who you need to talk to or where you need to look if you have a problem

pros:
-Good benefits
-Large Company with lots of opportunities
-Deep technical knowledge
-Decent work life balance
-Branch strives to foster relationships in house via events
-Valued diversity and inclusion
cons:
-Employees are stretched thin. Unreasonable workloads and stressful situations

advice_to_mgmt: -All employees must strive to foster an environment of learning and leaning on one another to achieve broader goals. The "every person for him/herself" mentality will not achieve sustainable success.
